publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-5513 Richard Lochhead: Scottish Environment Week—That the Parliament welcomes the forthcoming Scottish Environment Week which takes place from 5 to 11 February 2007; notes that the event will highlight the importance of our environment and its value to Scotland’s society and economy; further notes the importance of combating climate change which is threatening our planet, and recognises that Scotland, which is rich in clean-energy technology and renewable resources, should be at the forefront of tackling climate change to ensure that future generations can enjoy the same benefits from the environment.

S2M-5513 Scottish Environment Week (lodged on 30 January 2007) Stewart Stevenson*, Brian Adam*, Tommy Sheridan*, Mr John Swinney*, Jim Mather*, Mark Ballard*, Robin Harper*, Bruce Crawford*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Rob Gibson*, Christine Grahame*, Dave Petrie*, Carolyn Leckie*, Rosie Kane*, Frances Curran*, Fiona Hyslop*, Eleanor Scott*, Patrick Harvie*, Ms Maureen Watt*
S2M-5513 Scottish Environment Week (lodged on 30 January 2007) Donald Gorrie*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*

S2M-5513 Richard Lochhead: Scottish Environment Week—That the Parliament welcomes the forthcoming Scottish Environment Week which takes place from 5 to 11 February 2007; notes that the event will highlight the importance of our environment and its value to Scotland’s society and economy; further notes the importance of combating climate change which is threatening our planet, and recognises that Scotland, which is rich in clean-energy technology and renewable resources, should be at the forefront of tackling climate change to ensure that future generations can enjoy the same benefits from the environment. Supported by: Stewart Stevenson, Brian Adam, Tommy Sheridan, Mr John Swinney, Jim Mather, Mark Ballard, Robin Harper, Bruce Crawford, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Rob Gibson, Christine Grahame, Dave Petrie, Carolyn Leckie, Rosie Kane, Frances Curran, Fiona Hyslop, Eleanor Scott, Patrick Harvie, Ms Maureen Watt, Donald Gorrie, Mr Jamie Stone, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Roseanna Cunningham*, Ms Sandra White*, Michael Matheson*
S2M-5513 Scottish Environment Week (lodged on 30 January 2007) Mr Adam Ingram*
S2M-5513 Scottish Environment Week (lodged on 30 January 2007) Tricia Marwick*
S2M-5513 Scottish Environment Week (lodged on 30 January 2007) Dr Jean Turner*
S2M-5513 Scottish Environment Week (lodged on 30 January 2007) Linda Fabiani*

S2M-5513 Richard Lochhead: Scottish Environment Week—That the Parliament welcomes the forthcoming Scottish Environment Week which takes place from 5 to 11 February 2007; notes that the event will highlight the importance of our environment and its value to Scotland’s society and economy; further notes the importance of combating climate change which is threatening our planet, and recognises that Scotland, which is rich in clean-energy technology and renewable resources, should be at the forefront of tackling climate change to ensure that future generations can enjoy the same benefits from the environment. Supported by: Stewart Stevenson, Brian Adam, Tommy Sheridan, Mr John Swinney, Jim Mather, Mark Ballard, Robin Harper, Bruce Crawford, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Rob Gibson, Christine Grahame, Dave Petrie, Carolyn Leckie, Rosie Kane, Frances Curran, Fiona Hyslop, Eleanor Scott, Patrick Harvie, Ms Maureen Watt, Donald Gorrie, Mr Jamie Stone, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Roseanna Cunningham, Ms Sandra White, Michael Matheson, Mr Adam Ingram, Tricia Marwick, Dr Jean Turner, Linda Fabiani
